intro: Monechma fimbriatum, commonly known as the fringed spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and prairies. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with a distinctive fringed or toothed margin. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Monechma fimbriatum is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in the Euphorbiaceae family.
